2132.subject: NURS
2132.course_title_long: Management of Public and Nonprofit Organizations
2132.descrlong: Students are introduced to public and nonprofit healthcare systems; approaches to analyzing these systems, and their ability to achieve their missions. Students discuss management strategies used when working within these systems to effect positive change and improve service delivery. Students will be expected to participate in a variety of activities that will supplement reading assignments and lectures including attending a meeting of the governing board of a public or nonprofit organization.

2153.subject: NURS
2153.course_title_long: Management of Public and Nonprofit Organizations
2153.descrlong:
Students are introduced to public and nonprofit healthcare systems; approaches to analyzing these systems, and their ability to achieve their missions. Students discuss management strategies used when working within these systems to effect positive change and improve service delivery. Students will be expected to participate in a variety of activities that will supplement reading assignments and lectures including attending a meeting of the governing board of a public or nonprofit organization.

(Restricted to NURS Majors Only)

2154.subject: NURS
2154.descrlong:
Provides foundational knowledge of health care organizational systems and nursing leadership. Leadership strategies will be applied to effect positive change. Evaluation of public, private, for-profit, and nonprofit organizations will be conducted to determine overall effectiveness in healthcare delivery.

(Restricted to NURS Majors Only)
